Seasoned Air Fryer Bacon

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking to elevate your breakfast game, look no further than this seasoned air fryer bacon recipe. Crispy, flavorful, and oh-so-easy to make, this dish is a perfect addition to any morning meal or brunch spread. Cooking bacon in an air fryer not only delivers perfectly crispy strips but also reduces the mess and splatter often associated with traditional frying methods. The combination of black pepper, garlic powder, brown sugar, and paprika creates a mouthwatering seasoning that takes your bacon to the next level. Plus, with just a few simple steps and ingredients, you can have deliciously seasoned bacon ready in under 15 minutes. Whether you’re serving it alongside eggs, incorporating it into a sandwich, or simply enjoying it on its own, this seasoned air fryer bacon is sure to become a breakfast favorite. Get ready to indulge in the ultimate bacon experience!

Ingredients

bacon strips

Choose thick-cut bacon for a meatier texture and better flavor retention. If you're looking for a healthier option, turkey bacon or plant-based bacon can be used, though cooking times may vary. Ensure the strips are laid out flat in the air fryer for even cooking.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper has a more robust flavor than pre-ground. If you like heat, consider adding crushed red pepper flakes or using cayenne pepper for a spicy kick. For a milder flavor, white pepper can be used as a substitute.

garlic powder

Garlic powder is a great way to add flavor without the moisture of fresh garlic. If you prefer fresh garlic, use 1 clove minced instead of garlic powder. You can also experiment with garlic salt, reducing the amount of added salt in the recipe.

brown sugar

Brown sugar adds a lovely caramelized sweetness to the bacon. If you want a sugar-free alternative, consider using coconut sugar or a sugar substitute like erythritol, but be aware they may not caramelize the same way.

paprika

Paprika adds a mild sweetness and color. You can use smoked paprika for a smoky flavor or hot paprika if you want more heat. If you don't have paprika, regular chili powder can be a good substitute, adding a different flavor profile.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Air Fryer

    Set your air fryer to preheat at 400°F (200°C). This step ensures that your bacon cooks evenly and achieves that perfect crispy texture.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Seasoning

    In a small bowl, combine 1 teaspoon of black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1 teaspoon of brown sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon of paprika. Mix well to create a balanced seasoning blend that enhances the flavor of the bacon.

  • Step 3: Arrange the Bacon Strips

    Take 8 slices of bacon and lay them in a single layer in the air fryer basket. Make sure the slices do not overlap to allow for even cooking and crispiness.

  • Step 4: Season the Bacon

    Evenly sprinkle the prepared seasoning mixture over the bacon strips. This step is crucial as it will infuse the bacon with delicious flavors as it cooks.

  • Step 5: Air Fry the Bacon

    Cook the bacon in the air fryer for 8-10 minutes. It's important to check halfway through the cooking time to assess the level of crispiness and adjust cooking time if necessary.

  • Step 6: Drain and Serve

    Once cooked to your desired crispiness, carefully remove the bacon from the air fryer and let it drain on paper towels. This will help absorb any excess grease, making it less greasy and more enjoyable.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare bacon strips for the air fryer?

Simply take your bacon strips and lay them flat in the air fryer basket. Make sure they are in a single layer without overlapping to ensure even cooking.

What temperature should I set my air fryer to for cooking bacon?

Preheat your air fryer to 400°F (200°C) before adding the bacon. This high temperature helps achieve a crispy texture.

How long do I cook bacon in the air fryer?

Cook the bacon for 8-10 minutes, checking halfway through to see if they are crispy enough for your liking. Cooking times may vary based on the thickness of the bacon.

What should I do if the bacon is not crispy enough?

If the bacon isn't crispy after the initial cooking time, simply add a couple more minutes. Keep an eye on it to avoid burning.

How do I safely handle hot bacon after cooking?

Use tongs to carefully remove the bacon from the air fryer. Let it drain on paper towels to absorb excess grease and allow it to cool slightly before serving.

Can I season my bacon differently?

Absolutely! Feel free to experiment with different seasonings like cayenne pepper for heat or maple syrup for a sweet touch. Adjust the quantities according to your taste.

What can I do with the bacon grease left in the air fryer?

Let the grease cool, then carefully pour it into a heat-proof container. It can be used for cooking or flavoring other dishes, but be cautious as it is very hot.

Is it safe to cook bacon in an air fryer?

Yes, cooking bacon in an air fryer is safe. Just ensure you don't overcrowd the basket and always monitor the cooking process to avoid smoking.

How do I clean my air fryer after cooking bacon?

Once the air fryer has cooled down, clean the basket and tray with warm soapy water. Most air fryer components are dishwasher safe, but check your manufacturer’s instructions.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free, and for those on a low-carb or keto diet, the bacon is a great protein source. For a healthier twist, consider using turkey bacon or plant-based bacon alternatives for a lower-fat option. Adjust the seasoning according to dietary preferences, such as using coconut sugar instead of brown sugar for a refined sugar-free option.

Pairings

The seasoned air fryer bacon pairs wonderfully with fluffy scrambled eggs or a classic breakfast burrito, incorporating ingredients like avocado and salsa. For beverages, consider serving it alongside freshly squeezed orange juice or a rich, robust coffee. For a complete brunch experience, pair it with a light, fruity mimosa or a bold Bloody Mary.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the air fryer bacon on a warm platter to maintain its crispiness. Garnish with fresh herbs like parsley or chives for a pop of color and freshness. Consider serving it alongside a selection of dipping sauces, such as a spicy sriracha aioli or a maple syrup for a sweet-savory combination. For a more substantial meal, layer the bacon in a breakfast sandwich with eggs, cheese, and your choice of bread or bagel.

Description

Crispy, flavorful bacon cooked to perfection in your air fryer with minimal mess!

Ingredients

  • bacon strips: 8 slices
  • black pepper: 1 teaspoon
  • garlic powder: 1/2 teaspoon
  • brown sugar: 1 teaspoon
  • paprika: 1/2 teaspoon
